This Morning viewers have praised "inspirational" Ursula Shepherd who is learning to read at 87-years-old. 
The brave pensioner is proving it is never to late to learn and wants to encourage others to join her. 
Ursula admitted that she was ignored by teachers at school in the 1930s and left at 15 without being able to read or write. 
She would sit at the back of class with another pupil and would pretend to read but now wants to do it for real. Read More Ursula is learning to read at the age of 87 (Photo: ITV) She hopes to inspire others (Photo: ITV) 
The retired factory worker was motivated by her love of knitting and wanted to be able to read about patterns herself. 
Ursula said: "When I went to school, I was sat at the back with another person. I couldn’t read anything out of the book so I kept turning the pages over at the same time as her." 
"The teachers tried to help me and of course I kept getting my B’s and D’s wrong." Eamonn presented Ursula with some new pens and writing paper (Photo: ITV) 
Ursula, who was accompanied by her live-in carer Lesley Waller, read a section of her book out loud to hosts Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford and showed how well she could now read. 
The next challenge is to learn how to write, so she can send a letter to her brother-in-law John. 
Ursula, who has slight learning difficulties, added: "I hope I can inspire other people to read."
